page.title: 13Churches.
page.content: The parish church of St. Thomas A Becket in the village of Framfield is part of the Manor of South Malling which belonged to the Archbishop of Canterbury. Therefore its dedication to St. Thomas A Becket is rather appropriate. The principal part of the present church was built between 1200 and 1250 A.D. and the first rector was appointed in 1223. The earliest part of the church is named Hempstead Chapel. At present it is used as a clergy vestry and organ chamber.A smaller Chapel is the Bentley or Gage Chapel. Both Hempstead and Bentley were manor farms belonging to the Archbishop.This part of the church still maintains the original leaded lights and unusual clear and slightly tinted glass.
